isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - SERVICE ENGINE, REPLACE WITH SERVICE ENGINE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: SERVICE ENGINE, REPLACE WITH SERVICE ENGINE

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Disconnect battery.
Remove grille and front bumper.
Drain engine oil and coolant.
Disconnect air line and wire to shutter solenoid.
Disconnect spring at radiator retractable fill spout. Remove spout pivot arm retaining bolts at support bracket.
Disconnect coolant hose from radiator and fill spout.
Remove charge air pipes.
Disconnect all hose connections from upper radiator section; include wire harness connections / clamps.
Remove radiator support struts at engine mount brackets.
Disconnect lower radiator hose at radiator.
Disconnect transmission cooler lines at radiator. Cap ends.
Loosen lower radiator support bolts. Pull radiator assembly forward for access. Remove heater hose support bracket at radiator frame.
Install lifting device to radiator assembly. Remove lower radiator bolt. Remove radiator assembly.
Remove fan / clutch assembly.
Disconnect serpentine belt.
Remove radiator support strut bracket from engine. Remove upper radiator, by-pass and heater hoses from front of engine.
Disconnect alternator wiring. Remove alternator.
Remove exhaust manifold with turbo attache;, include disconnect air filter connection. Remove oil line and crankcase breather tube.
Disconnect accelerator linkage.

Disconnect air compressor main line and air filter hose at air compressor. Disconnect all wire harness clamps and wire connections necessary to remove engine, to include disconnect oil line and hoses at governor.
Disconnect power steering hoses at pump. Catch fluid and secure hoses out of way for access.
Remove skid plate from front crossmember, include hose support clamps at crossmember.
Disconnect fuel lines at filter, also at transmission support brackets.
Disconnect coolant and heater hoses at water pump outlet. Secure out of way for access.

Disconnect drive shaft safety bracket, also remove drive shaft. Disconnect transmission shift linkage at transmission. Remove bell housing bolts retaining support brackets, include disconnect ground wires attached to engine.
Remove front engine mount bolt and disconnect air line support bracket at left rear engine mount.
Remove bolts retaining front crossmember except (2).
Transfer right side engine lift bracket to rear section of engine right side, for better engine balance, while lifting.

Use fork lift. Support engine. Remove rear engine mount from left side of engine. Remove remaining bolts retaining front crossmember. Remove crossmember. Remove engine with transmission. This operation will take 2 people.

note.para: Be sure that the fork does not slide past the lifting chain when pulling the engine out of vehicle.

step1.para: Transfer all necessary engine parts and transmission to new engine.
Install new engine with transferred parts and transmission onto fork lift.
Place engine in vehicle (2 people).
Install rear engine mount and front crossmember.
Lower engine in position. Secure engine mounts front and rear. Remove fork lift and chain.
Transfer engine lifting bracket to front original position.
Connect air line to support bracket.
Connect drive shaft, safety support bracket and support bracket attached to transmission bell housing. Connect transmission linkage and engine grounds.
Connect coolant and heater hoses to engine.
Connect fuel lines and support brackets.
Install skid plate and hose support clamps to front crossmember.
Connect power steering hoses.
Connect all wire harness connections, and oil lines / hoses to air compressor and governor.
Connect accelerator linkage.
Install exhaust manifold with turbo. Connect air filter assembly, oil line and crankcase breather tube.
Install alternator and wiring.
Install radiator support strut bracket to engine. Connect all coolant hoses to engine.
Connect serpentine belt.
Install fan / clutch assembly.
Install radiator assembly; include secure / remove lifting device.
Connect all hoses to radiator.
Connect transmission cooler lines to radiator.
Install radiator support struts at engine mount bracket.
Install all wire harness connections and retaining clamps.
Install charge air pipes.
Install coolant fill spout.
Connect shutter hose and wire to shutter solenoid.
Fill engine oil, coolant system, power steering and transmission.
Connect battery.
Start engine, check for leaks and operation.
Bleed power steering per manual instructions.
Install grille and bumper.
Remove wheel chocks.
Road test vehicle. Check for leaks. Refill fluids as needed.
